Gale_SorcerousSundries.synopsis: Gale offers protection to Minsc in the Sorcerous Sundries shop

Halsin_BaldursMouth.synopsis: Minsc and Halsin talk about bar brawling

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance.synopsis: Minsc and Karlach apprach the Guildhall entrance

Wyll_Bonecloaks.synopsis: Minsc and Wyll enter Devil's Fee

Astarion_EasternDocks.synopsis: Minsc and Astarion talk about fish

Astarion_BasiliskGate.synopsis: Minsc and Astarion bond about being able to walk the streets again.

Karlach_UndercityRuins.synopsis: Minsc, previously Stone Lord of the Abandoned Cistern, thinks sewers are for bad people.

Wyll_Lodge.synopsis: Minsc and Wyll talk about the statue of Balduran at the Lodge

Jaheira_CazadorsPalace.synopsis: Minsc and Jaheira enter Cazador's Palace

Gale_HouseOfHope.synopsis: Minsc and Gale enter House of Hope

Jaheira_BloomridgePark.synopsis: Minsc and Jaheira enter Bloomridge Park

Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks.synopsis: Minsc and Halsin walk into a fireworks shop

Karlach_Berserkers.synopsis: Temp file to house bonus Minsc banters for VO

Gale_WaterQueen.synopsis: Minsc remembers how he tried to blow the Waterdeep conch

Wyll_WC_SouthSpan.synopsis: Minsc remembers when Danthelon's was called Armstrong's Arms. Bought a good sword there back in the day.

Jaheira_GeneralSewers.synopsis: Minsc and Jaheira enter the sewers

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid.synopsis: Minsc and Jaheira enter Blushing Mermaid

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.text: Do not think your twinkly-eyed wiles will work on us, vampire lord.
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.context: NodeContext: Warning stupid sexy vampire lord Astarion that he isn't fooled

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.text: Oh, I know I could never tempt you, but maybe your little friend would like to perch on a more elegant shoulder?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_1.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_1.text: Do not look into his eyes, Boo! Think not of nesting in his thick and downy mane!
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_1.context: NodeContext: Scandalised, but also way too specific about Astarion's hair for someone who hasn't thought about it before

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_0.text: You'll never know unless you try. Just once? Maybe you'll like it.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.text: Minsc has felt Boo's heart is fluttering faster than usual... for our friend the Blade is betrothed.
Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: Wink wink, nudge nudge - happy for Wyll

Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.text: Ah, my thanks. Perhaps we might even marry, if fate wills it.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.text: If you cannot find a bear to be the bearer of your ring, Boo would like you to know that he is available.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.text: Karlach - do I see you gazing long at Boo? You wish to have a hamster of your own, I think.
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.context: NodeContext: Amused, fond - people marvel at Boo all the time, it's only natural

Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.text: I wouldn't say no. But really I was thinking... how old is he, Minsc?
Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Snapping out of staring at Boo, nervously broaching a tricky topic

Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.text: He is quite obviously in his prime. For a miniature giant space hamster.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.text: And he's always looked the exact same? No chance Jaheira's been swapping him out every few years?
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Doesn't outright want to ask if he's been swapping a generation of Boos down through the years.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_4.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_ROM_Act3_4.text: Karlach! Minsc and Boo thought better of you, than to be so concerned with looks.
Karlach_ROM_Act3_4.context: NodeContext: Disappointed in Karlach for judging Boo by his appearance, perhaps missing her actual point asking about whether Boo has changed appearance over the years

Gale_SorcerousSundries_3.speaker: Minsc
Gale_SorcerousSundries_3.text: Minsc has never trusted places such as this. Too much of a wizard's power can be simply packaged and picked up.
Gale_SorcerousSundries_3.context: NodeContext: Grumbling as we make our way through the shelves at Sorcerous Sundiries.

Gale_SorcerousSundries_1.speaker: Minsc
Gale_SorcerousSundries_1.text: Well, picked up by all but Minsc. When he touches the many delicate little jars, oh how the wizards shout and stare!
Gale_SorcerousSundries_1.context: NodeContext: Revealing that his objection to Sorcerous Sundries is not in fact a deep philosophical belief that wizards have too much power - they just make him feel stupid and awkward when he pokes at their things.

Gale_SorcerousSundries_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_SorcerousSundries_0.text: Fear not, Minsc. You have a wizard at your side who positively encourages such curiosity. You'll fit right in.

Gale_SorcerousSundries_2.speaker: Minsc
Gale_SorcerousSundries_2.text: Obliged, wizard. Should we find our way to a weaponsmith, Minsc will rough you up a little - so that you too can fit in.
Gale_SorcerousSundries_2.context: NodeContext: Warm, comradely - would genuinely be doing Gale a favour.

Halsin_BaldursMouth_3.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_BaldursMouth_3.text: See, Boo? They have made their repairs. The owner once used Boo to mop up her ale, and she and Minsc had a discussion on the matter.
Halsin_BaldursMouth_3.context: NodeContext: Walking into a tavern he once wrecked. Second part said by way of explanation to his companion, Halsin.

Halsin_BaldursMouth_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_BaldursMouth_1.text: Trouble seems to seek you out, Minsc. I know the feeling - the larger you are, the more likely someone wishes to test themselves against you.

Halsin_BaldursMouth_0.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_BaldursMouth_0.text: Minsc sometimes wishes he was small as Boo - so that he might sit and listen to the storytellers in peace.
Halsin_BaldursMouth_0.context: NodeContext: Genuinely hard-done by - he genuinely doesn't want the hassle.

Halsin_BaldursMouth_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_BaldursMouth_2.text: Perhaps you should study the druidic arts - with wildshape, you could make yourself as diminutive as you please. Smaller than Boo, even.

Halsin_BaldursMouth_4.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_BaldursMouth_4.context: NodeContext: Getting it. Increasing excitement at the image m.

Astarion_UpperTracks_3.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_UpperTracks_3.text: Oh, I do not know, Boo. If you buried the nuts here before we were stone, I am thinking they might have gone bad.

Astarion_UpperTracks_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_UpperTracks_1.text: Minsc! Enough! The hamster isn't saying a damn thing and you know it.

Astarion_UpperTracks_2.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_UpperTracks_2.text: Well, Astarion. Boo is of good breeding, and so only speaks when he has something nice to say.

Astarion_UpperTracks_0.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_UpperTracks_0.text: Perhaps this is why he has never seen fit to speak to you.

Astarion_UpperTracks_4.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_UpperTracks_4.text: How delightfully vicious. I'm beginning to like the hamster.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.text: Boo has been speaking to a certain squirrel-friend who frequents our camp, Halsin.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.text: He was turned from a red squirrel to a grey, all by one shocking sight. Minsc thinks you owe him an apology.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.text: Apologise for partaking in one of nature's most solemn rites? That squirrel should be glad to bear witness.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.text: ...No, Boo, I do not know what this has to do with the bears...
Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.context: NodeContext: Aside, to Boo. Misunderstanding 'bear witness'. Shaking head, doesn't understand Halsin at all.

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_3.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_3.text: Are you familiar with the evil works of Nine-Fingers and her Guild, Karlach?

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_0.text: I've Heard of her - and everyone knows the Guild. They're not bad if you know how to work 'em.

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_2.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_2.text: Hm. Boo and I, we are in need of honest berserkers to keep the Guild honest in turn. Will you show us how this 'working' is done?
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_2.context: NodeContext: Mulling over the difficult task of reining in Nine-Fingers - wants Karlach's help.

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_1.text: Sure. The trick is to let them mess with you just once, and show 'em what happens. They won't try again.

Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_4.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_4.text: Minsc means to do no working. When he breaks the guildmaster, it will be for the fun of it alone.
Karlach_GuildhallEntrance_4.context: NodeContext: Darkly - his bile towards Nine-Fingers (pre-confrontation) is directly proportional to the guilt he refuses to acknowledge around being the Stone Lord.

Wyll_Bonecloaks_2.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_Bonecloaks_2.text: Who adorned these walls? Better to have hung a mirror, and taken a good long look at themselves.
Wyll_Bonecloaks_2.context: NodeContext: Very slightly aghast at the devilish / creepy decoration of the place.

Wyll_Bonecloaks_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Bonecloaks_0.text: A bloody display of murderous power. Bhaal means to stoke fear, make us cower.

Wyll_Bonecloaks_1.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_Bonecloaks_1.text: All it does is make Minsc wonder if Boo has already eaten this villain's eyes.

Karlach_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_MorphicPool_1.text: Karlach, this brain we go to bully - Boo has suggested it is large. Wizard-brain large? Boo-brain large?

Karlach_MorphicPool_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MorphicPool_4.text: Like... as many Boo-brains as a mortal mind can fathom. It's an elder brain, after all. You heard of those?

Karlach_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_MorphicPool_0.context: NodeContext: Of course he obviously knows what an Elder Brain is. But he's juta about to ask anyway, in case.

Karlach_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MorphicPool_2.text: Honestly, I'm not completely sure. But I know it'll be no match for you, me, and the hamster.

Astarion_EasternDocks_3.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_EasternDocks_3.context: NodeContext: Struck by a brilliant idea, so excited he cannot use his words

Astarion_EasternDocks_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_EasternDocks_1.text: Minsc, please - slow down. Use your words.

Astarion_EasternDocks_0.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_EasternDocks_0.text: Minsc has thought how you might be a more virtuous vampire - feast on fish instead. They are made of naught but neck!
Astarion_EasternDocks_0.context: NodeContext: Delighted with himself, as if it's a matter he's been mulling over for some time. If he must travel with 'bad' people, he will try to make them 'better'.

Astarion_EasternDocks_4.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_EasternDocks_4.text: It's a sweet thought, but fish just doesn't have the flavour of full-blooded red meat.

Astarion_EasternDocks_2.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_EasternDocks_2.text: No, you do not 'agree', Boo. I told you you have been spending far too much time around the pale one...
Astarion_EasternDocks_2.context: NodeContext: Hushed, style of a whispered argument that's been had before, trailing off to be discussed later. Minsc is worried that his hamster is being corrupted.

Astarion_BasiliskGate_3.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_BasiliskGate_3.text: Ah, but it is a fine thing to walk with friends beneath the warming sun!

Astarion_BasiliskGate_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_BasiliskGate_0.text: Friends' might be a stretch, but otherwise - yes, I fully agree!

Astarion_BasiliskGate_1.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_BasiliskGate_1.text: You might have your cloudy locks to keep the heat off your head, but do not forget that Minsc has Boo! We will be like twins, eh?

Astarion_BasiliskGate_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_BasiliskGate_2.text: We will? Gods - two hundred years and I've never missed seeing my reflection more.

Karlach_UndercityRuins_3.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_UndercityRuins_3.text: A dead and foul place. Only a villain would nest down in these tunnels.

Karlach_UndercityRuins_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_UndercityRuins_0.text: Hang on, weren't you living in the sewer?

Karlach_UndercityRuins_2.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_UndercityRuins_2.text: Entirely different! That was foul only in its smells, and the way our water tasted. But it was home.

Karlach_UndercityRuins_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_UndercityRuins_4.text: Fair enough, buddy. Home is where the heart is, anyway.

Karlach_UndercityRuins_1.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_UndercityRuins_1.text: Ah - in that case, home is in my pocket, nestled on soft bed of flesh and fluff.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.text: Boo will not permit himself to be held by you any longer, Shadowheart.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.text: He fears you will sacrifice him in some Sharran ritual of dark oils and leather.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.text: Oh, he's far too precious for that. I'll go find a comely barmaid or guardsman instead.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.context: NodeContext: Cheeky. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Wyll_Lodge_3.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_Lodge_3.text: Who is this large man of sternness and stone? Boo mislikes his look - as if he is knowing things that Minsc is not.

Wyll_Lodge_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Lodge_2.text: It's Balduran. Our city's valorant founder - and now, the illithid we carry in that gods-forsaken prism.

Wyll_Lodge_4.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_Lodge_4.text: Ah. Then Minsc and Boo prefer him this way. Better stern than smug.

Wyll_Lodge_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Lodge_0.text: Relax, the both of you - it's Balduran, our city's valorant founder.

Wyll_Lodge_1.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_Lodge_1.text: Ahh, this makes more sense! Some relation to the Baldur who owns the gate perhaps, Boo?

Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_3.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_3.text: If Minsc had any hairs on his head, this place would set them all a-standing. And look how Boo's bunches his hackles!
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_3.context: NodeContext: A little hushed, picking our way through a vampire's mansion.

Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_0.text: We three have come through darker places than this together, Minsc.
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_0.context: NodeContext: A little hushed, serious,  picking our way through a vampire's mansion. Trying to be comforting.

Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_2.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_2.context: NodeContext: A little hushed, picking our way through a vampire's mansion. Can't help but correct him.

Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_1.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_1.text: Does Jaheira not set your heart at ease, Boo? It is comforting, to know that one so wise can be so wrong.
Jaheira_CazadorsPalace_1.context: NodeContext: A little hushed, picking our way through a vampire's mansion. Warm - he has genuinely taken comfort from this.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.text: Shadowheart. I saw you pluck Boo from the ground, when you thought no one was watching.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.context: NodeContext: Had been mulling this, now broaching it.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.text: It pleases you, to hold him? And you have truly cleansed yourself of Shar?
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_4.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, but giving benefit of the doubt.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.text: I suppose you're right. On both counts.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar, and got to play with a hamster.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.text: HMMMMMMMM. Then for one day only, you may carry him in your pocket. So long as it is clean. Padded. Well-aired.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_3.context: NodeContext: Dubious, but willing to extend this great honour to her against his  better judgement. Listing off Boo's rider.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.speaker: Minsc
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.context: NodeContext: Rushing in the most important condition of all.

Gale_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Minsc
Gale_ROM_Act3_1.text: Gale. Minsc worries you might send a fireball up his butt, with all of this stringy hair in your face.

Gale_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.text: Is that why you keep your head shaved? I assumed it was a custom of some sort.
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: Curious, referring to Minsc's origins

Gale_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Minsc
Gale_ROM_Act3_3.text: Oh, no! Most warriors of Rashemen wear long battle-braids, weighed down with stone. Minsc can show you, when next we camp?

Gale_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.text: Thank you, but I'm more wizard than warrior. I'm not sure my scalp would stand up to such a plaiting.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Minsc
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: Bah! Fine, Boo. Lae'zel - my hamster wishes me to tell you:
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Giving in to Boo's nagging.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Minsc
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: You are the most beautiful thing he has ever seen.
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: Not outright disgusted and mean, but really doesn't want to be the messenger here.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: I'm afraid I can't return the sentiment - but I know of some githyanki who would find him quite... appealing. Mouth-watering, in fact.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.speaker: Minsc
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.text: No, Boo. Astarion is a friend now - he would never bite you.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.text: Yes... I mean - no? I am not interested in biting the rodent is the point.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.text: Not least because he lives in your trousers...

Gale_HouseOfHope_3.speaker: Minsc
Gale_HouseOfHope_3.text: Gale! You will perhaps able to explain where Boo has not - what exactly is the difference between a devil and a demon?

Gale_HouseOfHope_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_HouseOfHope_0.text: A fascinating question, one that boils down to which criteria we choose to apply. Are we speaking about the physiological? Theological? Etymological?
Gale_HouseOfHope_0.context: NodeContext: In teacher mode - up for an in depth, intellectual discussion

Gale_HouseOfHope_2.speaker: Minsc
Gale_HouseOfHope_2.context: NodeContext: Non-plussed, Echoing Gale's ending every word with 'ical'

Gale_HouseOfHope_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_HouseOfHope_1.text: Oh. Then for your purposes, they are exactly the same.

Jaheira_BloomridgePark_3.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_BloomridgePark_3.text: All of these statues - could they, too, be heroes all? Frozen in stone until the city has need of them?

Jaheira_BloomridgePark_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BloomridgePark_0.text: The Harpers keep records of those who fought for the city - I think I would recall mention of a bare-assed little cherub in all our story and song.

Jaheira_BloomridgePark_1.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_BloomridgePark_1.text: Well. Boo would also think you would have noticed when Minsc himself was frozen for over a century.
Jaheira_BloomridgePark_1.context: NodeContext: Just a LITTLE bit haughty

Jaheira_BloomridgePark_2.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BloomridgePark_2.text: ... do you know, I had forgotten just how catty your hamster can be.

Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_3.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_3.text: Bah. Boo says the many colours remind him of home, but Minsc has never enjoyed these fireworks.

Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_1.text: They may have their purposes. You could cast fireballs of sorts, without having to spend years studying magic tomes.

Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_0.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_0.text: ...Archdruid. You are as formidable in mind as you are in muscle.

Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_2.speaker: Minsc
Halsin_FelogyrsFireworks_2.text: Gather the sparking sticks, Boo! With sword in one hand and these in the other, we need truck with wizards no more!

Karlach_Berserkers_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Berserkers_4.text: Minsc, you come from an entire nation of berserkers. Give me some of those good Rashemaar pointers.

Karlach_Berserkers_1.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_Berserkers_1.text: Oh. There is much to be learned. Deep breaths. Meditative trances. Strange and stinking mushrooms.

Karlach_Berserkers_3.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_Berserkers_3.text: But Minsc could master none of this. Which made him sad. Which made him mad. Which made him the berserker you see before you.

Karlach_Berserkers_2.speaker: Minsc
Karlach_Berserkers_2.text: And there is always Boo, with the needful nip when anger is slow in coming. This is not how you do it...?

Gale_WaterQueen_3.speaker: Minsc
Gale_WaterQueen_3.text: Umberlee - her clerics possess a nasty streak as wide as her oceans.

Gale_WaterQueen_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_WaterQueen_1.text: So their reputation suggests - especially among the good folk of Waterdeep. I'm curious to learn how you fell foul of them...
Gale_WaterQueen_1.context: NodeContext: Wasn't expecting Minsc to be familiar with a cult most associated with Waterdeep

Gale_WaterQueen_0.speaker: Minsc
Gale_WaterQueen_0.text: 'Blasphemy', said the temple priestess. But Minsc says: do not give horns to your statues if you do not wish the visitors to try and make them toot.
Gale_WaterQueen_0.context: NodeContext: Sulky child. Maintains to this day he was not wrong to clamber onto Umberlee's statue and toot her conch shell.

Gale_WaterQueen_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_WaterQueen_2.text: Yes, that would probably do it.
Gale_WaterQueen_2.context: NodeContext: Stumped - this is a truly stupid/inane reason to have angered the clerics of Umberlee

Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_3.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_3.text: Danthelon's Dancing Axe...? Minsc would sooner fight with a sword - even an annoying one, which talks out of turn.
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_3.context: NodeContext: Reading a scene as he passes, not convinced

Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_0.text: I'm surprised you're so fond of swords. A battleaxe would seem more suitable for a man of your... stature.

Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_1.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_1.text: The sword is simpler - only one point, so you know which end the evil goes on! But I suppose a warrior must wield whatever weapon he can.
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_1.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not sure he can justify his preferences

Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_2.speaker: Minsc
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_2.text: Sword, axe, boot... Minsc once choked an ogre with its own loincloth. The smell might be the closest I have come to tasting of death myself.
Wyll_WC_SouthSpan_2.context: NodeContext: Hint of PTSD creeping in at the end.

Jaheira_GeneralSewers_2.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_GeneralSewers_2.text: AH! The smell of adventure, in the very heart of the city!

Jaheira_GeneralSewers_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_GeneralSewers_0.context: NodeContext: Not mirroring Minsc's enthusiasm, distaste at foul smell

Jaheira_GeneralSewers_1.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_GeneralSewers_1.text: Better yet! What swifter way to strike at evil's butt than to crawl through its innards?

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_4.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_4.text: Jaheira, Minsc's memory of his last time in this taproom is a little... fuzzy. Did he...?
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_4.context: NodeContext: Vaguely looking around the Blushing Mermaid

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_0.text: Fear not, Rashemaar. It has never been your way to over-indulge.
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_0.context: NodeContext: Smiling, putting him out of his misery that he might've gotten too drunk

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_2.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_2.text: But you did offend one of my contacts by letting Boo paddle around in her tankard. Pewter, I believe - she cracked it over your head.

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_3.speaker: Minsc
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_3.text: Oh, praise the Three! Minsc was afraid he had shamed myself. I will, eh, leave a penny at the bar.
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_3.context: NodeContext: Palpable relief. This is a much more acceptable outcome.

Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_1.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BlushingMermaid_1.text: Best leave two. I cracked her with my own, afterward. She was drinking grog - Boo's backside could only have improved it.
